questions.question_text:
Your client's legacy system uses a hierarchical parent/child relationship to organize customer information because a single customer may have more than one bank account or payment method.
Does this prevent you from using the Oracle Fusion Trading Community Model Data Import program?

choices.E: The use of parent, child, and grandchild table hierarchies is allowed only in Accounts Payable, not Accounts Receivable.
choices.A: The program allows the use of parent, child, and grandchild table hierarchies, but it requires multiple Customer Master records for each customer within the hierarchy.
choices.B: The program allows table hierarchies for customer bank accounts, but not for other customer information.
choices.D: Yes; the program specifically prohibits parent, child, and grandchild table hierarchies to represent the hierarchy of data in the customer information.
choices.C: No; the program contains parent, child, and grandchild table hierarchies to represent the hierarchy of data in the customer information.

discussion.content:
C

Customer data includes, for example, Parties, Party Sites, Accounts, Account Sites, Site Uses, along with associated customer attributes, such as customer profiles, customer payment methods, and customer bank accounts.

For example, a customer party can have one or more accounts and other associated attributes; a customer account can have one or more sites and other associated attributes; a customer account site can have one or more site uses and other associated attributes.

questions.question_text:
Your customer has three business units. The customer wants to share customer account addresses across these business units.
Which reference data set can be used to achieve this?

choices.B: Assign a COMMON reference data set to the business units, which share the account addresses.
choices.D: Create a separate reference data set for each business unit and assign it to each unit.
choices.C: Assign an enterprise reference data set to the business units, which share the account addresses.
choices.A: Create a new reference data set for account addresses and assign it to the business units.

discussion.content: C is correct , Application rule set is mandatory at the system options and optional at transaction type setup

Receivables uses the application rule set assigned to the transaction type to process payment applications. If no application rule set is assigned to the transaction type, then the application rule set assigned to Receivables system options is used.

You can arrange the order of the line types and application rules in an application rule set according to your needs. Each line type must appear in an application rule set, and appear only once. The Overapplication rule is always last in the sequence.

questions.question_text: When you move revenue on an invoice line from an unearned account to an earned revenue account, Receivables ______________.

discussion.content:
A. Solution is correct.

Adjusting Revenue
When you move revenue on an invoice line from an unearned to an earned revenue account, or vice versa, Oracle Fusion Receivables removes the invoice line revenue contingencies. The invoice is no longer subject to automatic revenue recognition.

This does not apply to adjustments to sales credits, because you can only adjust sales credits on revenue that has already been scheduled.
